CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 23, 1951, pg. 3 reads: "Free At Last - Attractive Edna White, 24-year-old mother of three children, shakes the hand of her attorney, Herbert Blumenfeld, and says, "Oh you don't know how good it is to be free and on my way home to Harrisburg to my children." Mrs. White, convicted last January of manslaughter in stabbing of her boyfriend, Marcel Graham, languished in jail as Attorney Blumenfeld fought diligently to free her from stiff sentence. Monday Judge Clarence B. Nixon gave her eight to twenty-three months in workhouse. She had already served nine months of the sentence in jail. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Edna White, shaking hand of Atty. Herbert Blumenfeld in corridor of Allegheny County Courthouse
